reviews.text: Thought we would visit this station seeing how its been renovated my advice is dont bother drove round n round looking for a car space (of which we were'nt the only ones ) only 9 am in the morning and no chance what so eva . So decided to go to the good old earlestown station no problem parking needless to say i wont be goin back to newton !!!!!

It's OK as a station, and now the building work is mostly done it looks good. However, the new car park gets full (as I stresfully found shortly before my train was due), and the only ticket machine (should really be more than one) on the North side of the station was out of service despite looking brand new. There are plenty of worse stations about though.

The train service itself has been OK when I've used this station in the past too.

Now mostly open, lots more parking and free. But only one toilet for the whole station? A few niggles such as bikes being stolen and the cctv not turned on, departure boards seem to crash. But lots better but lots more to be done and to be finished.

This station has a 100+ space car park, a large waiting room with air consitioning, new ticket machienes and ticket office, Lifts for both platforms, A shelter on the platforms.

This station also has the following services
(tph = trains per hour)
1Tph to Newcastle, via manchester Victoria
1Tph to Crewe via mamchester picc, air
1Tph to Llandudno via chester and runcorn east
2Tph to Liverpool Lime Street
1tph to manchester piccadilly (fast)

The station sometimes features services to Norwich via Manchester if the other rail line is under maintenance, which is common until the new merseyrail trains come out.
